attributes.action: Protect hedgerow habitat from excessive use of mechanised equipment
attributes.background:
Make annual / biannual hedge and underbrush cutting with tractor-driven blades illegal.
Licence flail and rotary cutting equipment operation.
Ensure setaside subsidies are provided only where the entire ecosystem within the given boundary is protected, including hedgerow cover in such a mandate.
attributes.additional_details: Annual and bi-annual hedge cutting across the UK has brought about sharp declines of hedgerow-dependent wildlife. There is widely visible evidence that Government guidelines on the frequency of mechanised cuts are not being followed and field margin setaside payments are being wasted on sterile ecosystems as a result. The Health and Harmony document cites the importance of sustainable land management and the role landowners play in the welfare of the countryside. We agree with this citation.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for landowners.

attributes.action: Bring back Britain’s lost rainforests
attributes.background: The Government should protect and restore Britain’s lost temperate rainforests by implementing a ‘Great British Rainforests Strategy’. This must include a high-level commitment to restoration alongside sufficient funding and protection measures.
attributes.additional_details: Few people realise that Britain is home to temperate rainforest, a globally rare and important habitat. The rainforests are astonishingly beautiful, and they are wildlife- and carbon-rich habitats, home to many rare and unique species of lichens, mosses, fungi, birds, insects and mammals. Despite their significance, Britain’s temperate rainforests now only remain in fragmented pockets, but there is considerable potential for the habitat to expand across the country.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a decision for individual landowners.  

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to fund the creation or development of temperate rainforests.

attributes.action: The government must rescind emergency authorisation of neonicotinoid pesticides
attributes.background: George Eustace MP, Secretary of State for the Environment, cannot sanction deployment of neonicotinoid pesticides given the link between use of these extremely harmful chemicals and the dramatic decline in bee populations.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing the use of neonicotinoid pesticides anywhere in the UK is completely at odds with goverment aims to protect the environment and restore wildlife habitats. A red line must be drawn banning their use altogether, with no get-out clauses for emergency deployment.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606788

attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks to the general public
attributes.background:
Not allow fireworks to be sold to the general public, only allow the sale to licensed firework display teams. 

Hundreds of animals suffer for weeks with the general public allowed to purchase and set off fireworks in residential areas with no regard for animals' welfare and the distress caused.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that fireworks have extreme adverse effects on pets, farm animals and wildlife. People suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder can be also affected by the unpredictable noises and people with autism can suffer from sensory overload. Fireworks are legally allowed to be set off several weeks prior to Guy Fawkes' Night, which causes an extended period of suffering for the aforementioned groups. Consider the ban of public sale to increase the attendance of public displays instead.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/591501

attributes.action: Prevent strike action from disrupting public services like rubbish collection
attributes.background: It is important for workers to have the right to protest if they are not satisfied with their working conditions, however this cannot interrupt basic services such as rubbish collection that we pay council tax for as residents.
attributes.additional_details: Local councils should have the option to hire private services to collect rubbish if normal collection services are interrupted by strike action. Allowing rubbish to pile up on our streets and in our gardens should never be allowed to happen - It creates very serious health issues for a large portion of the population, it's bad for the environment (Wildlife can easily access the rubbish) and recycling is not necessarily disposed of properly, to name a few serious problems this creates.

rejection.details: Councils are already able to hire private services and decisions around rubbish collection lie with councils, rather than the Government. You might want to start a petition asking the Government to provide additional funding to support Councils to hire alternative private services.

attributes.action: Reduce cutting our roadside verges
attributes.background: Adopt the wildlife-friendly management guidelines jointly coined by Plantlife, the Highways Authorities and other organizations on Hampshire’s roadside verges, to help wildlife and the environment, creating Carbon sinks, saving money, and achieving governmental land and environment targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, many roadside verges in my home county (Hampshire) are cut 12+ times annually, wasting our taxes, and suppressing a valuable wildlife habitat. If Plantlife's management guide were adopted, these featureless verges would turn into wildflower meadows, growing far slower than the current turfs, and absorbing Carbon 3x faster than Forest. The management guide details exactly how this will be done practically and safely. Please only sign this if you live/work/study in Hampshire.

Thankyou.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action:

Work with councils to promote wildflower and grassland growth
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585792

attributes.action: Festival attendees must fill 1 bin liner bag of litter per ticket upon exit
attributes.background: Make it compulsory that each person attending festivals in the UK must fill one bin liner with litter upon exit of the festival to prevent scenes like Leeds Festivals aftermath 2021
attributes.additional_details: There are hundreds of thousands of pieces of litter left after festivals in the UK costing thousands to clean up at a huge cost to the environment and wildlife

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about managing sites for festivals are a matter for the organisers, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

If you want to start a new petition, you would need to provide your full name.

attributes.action: Build more wildlife crossings in the UK to save lives
attributes.background: Wildlife crossings are bridges built across roads and railways that are usually planted with a variety of local trees, shrubs or other vegetation. They allow birds, mammals and insects to keep moving despite a road or railway blocking their path, significantly reducing the likelihood of accidents.
attributes.additional_details: There are currently only 2 wildlife crossings in the UK, which simply isn’t enough of an effort to protect our species and landscape. By building more, wildlife migration corridors can be preserved and healthy, connected landscapes promoted. They can also reduce vehicle accidents that result in human fatalities, property damage and wildlife mortality by 85-95%. Not only would this be saving money, but also saving lives.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574350

If you choose to start a new petition in future, please be sure to include your full name as we can't accept petitions which are started using just a first name.

attributes.action: Stop building on Essex countryside.
attributes.background: So many proposals are being put forward to build on our countryside and green belt land in and around Essex. We are losing all out beauty spots and it’s destroying the very thing that attracts people to Essex, the countryside. Wildlife is being affected and there is not enough infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details:
Crime rates are increasing in Essex, police are stretched, doctors are full, roads are clogged and there are continual proposals to build more and more houses. Wildlife will deplete and all our walking paths and countryside will be destroyed.
This needs to stop!

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about planning decisions in your area you could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Prioritise brownfield development in law to protect our green belt and farmland: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575169

attributes.action: Conserve and protect wildlife by reducing single use plastics in packaging.
attributes.background: Encourage use of recyclable materials rather than single use plastics in packaging. Limit the amount of single use plastics suppliers can use as well as making it compulsory to display the plastic's lifetime on the packaging. Provide more information on the benefits of recycling.
attributes.additional_details: Our local area is the epicenter littering and plastic waste and we as an NCS team want to do something about it. For too long, we young people have had to walk through plastic filled streets and past overflowing bins. This has had a catastrophic impact on wildlife in the city as well as the rural areas near to us. With climate change an ever present problem, we want to become NCS change makers in our local community and we want you to be a part of our plans.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban the use of plastic packaging for all non-food items: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570065

Ban packaging that is not biodegradable or domestically recyclable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574939

Ban the use of virgin plastics in all packaging sold in the UK before 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586539

attributes.action: Put more effort into improving biodiversity in the uk
attributes.background: Make more parks and wildlife reserves available and protect existing ones.
attributes.additional_details: If they don't do this then Co2 emissions will increase in the atmosphere and will contribute to the greenhouse effect and will increase health problems.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as funding local councils to create more green spaces.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of disposable BBQs
attributes.background: Ban the sale of disposable BBQs to avoid devastating wildfires. People are increasingly taking these cheap and accessible BBQs into open countryside and setting off wildfires. These are devastating for our wildlife and putting firefighters lives at risk
attributes.additional_details: Disposable BBQs are being heavily promoted in supermarkets, petrol stations and local shops. Anyone can pick one up for £5 and take it into open countryside. Wildfires, as a result of this irresponsible behaviour, are now occurring all too often destroying wildlife, habitats and putting our firefighters lives at risk. Local communities have had enough and want to see a final ban on disposable BBQs in order to reduce the fire risk which is devastating our countryside.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581929

attributes.action: Make loose fruit and veg cheaper than fruit and veg in plastic.
attributes.background: The fruit and veg wrapped in plastic is cheaper than the loose fruit and veg. This needs to be changed so that people will buy the loose fruit and veg resulting in our consumption of plastic being reduced. Some countries are already doing this. Why can't we?
attributes.additional_details: We are living in a climate crisis. If we do not make the changes necessary then humanity may not survive the consequences. Before the 1950s nothing in shops was wrapped in plastic meaning that it is possible and we can do it again. This would just be one step to becoming a more sustainable society and stopping the destruction of our planet and ourselves. The plastic that is destroying our oceans and wildlife eventually gets back to us and negatively impacts our health. This is effecting us too.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a matter for retailers.

You might like to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577169

attributes.action: Make the global wildlife trade illegal in the UK
attributes.background: The global wildlife trade is currently LEGAL in the UK, this means that when people buy pets (particularly exotic pets) they may have been taken from the wild to be someone's pet. These animals are usually kept in bad conditions throughout their journey from the wild to the UK.
attributes.additional_details: This poses a huge threat to the public's health. Many animals carry serious diseases that can lead to pandemics. The global wildlife trade is medieval and outright wrong. The fact that animals are being taken from the wild into the UK legally is disgusting, but the fact that so many people are unaware of it is worse. Many animals end up dead due to the bad conditions throughout the journey. By making the global wildlife trade illegal we could prevent future pandemics and keep animals safe.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the trade of certain animals, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition asks for the Government to make the "global wildlife trade" illegal, but it's not clear exactly what you want to be made illegal. There are already a number of rules and regulations relating to the import and keeping of animals.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to ban the import of all exotic animals, or animals that are intended to be sold as pets, if either of those are something you want to happen.

attributes.action: Ban six and four pack plastic rings holding beer cans together !
attributes.background: Ban these totally unnecessary plastic rings holding cans together, they cause untold suffering and death to wildlife on land and in the sea!
attributes.additional_details: Hold beer companies responsible for how they package their goods and it's effects on the environment!

rejection.details:

Ban the use of plastic 6 pack rings in the UK

attributes.action: Ban the sale of noisy fireworks to the general public.
attributes.background: To prevent the extreme distress to household pets and wildlife including farm animals, limit noisy fireworks to licenced events only.  Allow the general public to buy fireworks that display light and colour only, no noise.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks are let off all year round nowadays. They are let off for religion festivals/events, Birthday celebrations, Christmas, New Year, Firework night goes on for weeks before the 5th November and after.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Make illegal to sell fireworks except to licensed community organisations.
attributes.background:
Local councils should be empowered to grant (and rescind) licenses for any community group or organisation wishing to buy fireworks for a safe community fireworks display.
Nobody without such a license should be able to buy or use fireworks at any time.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks can be fun, when handled appropriately. However every year too many of us suffer awfully due to them being set off at anti-social times, night after night, and/or in an anti-social and dangerous manner. Our sleep is disturbed and our safety threatened. Many people (eg. survivors of war or other violence) are re-traumatised, anxious humans and pets are scared, wildlife are disturbed or even injured/killed. Humans are injured every year, with life-changing injuries and cost to the NHS.

attributes.additional_details: because firework upsets people with autism and kills Pets and  Wildlife gives them heart attack it needs too be stop at all cause no more of this pets and wildlife are dying needs too be STOP RIGHT NOW

attributes.action: Demand compensation from plastic producers for every British citizen.
attributes.background: I want parliament to force plastic producers to pay compensation to the public for the nuisance, unsightliness and danger of plastic pollution on land and at sea. Our wildlife, beaches, towns and countryside are awash with non-recyclable, non-biodegradable plastic and drastic action is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Companies in the business of producing plastic have historically misled the government and the public about how reusable and recyclable they are. Plastics are not very reusable or recyclable and the production of plastic needs to be halted unless it is shown to be wholly recyclable or biodegradable. In the meantime, restitution must be paid for the damage done by plastic pollution and the misleading information about resuability and recycling.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Compensation is a matter for the courts.

We could publish a petition calling for the Government to impose a levy on all plastic production in the UK, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Stop the building of a new coal mine in Cumbria.
attributes.background:
The first new deep coalmine in the UK in 30 years has been approved to be built in Cumbria. 
This is an indefensible decision that contradicts the country's commitment to being carbon neutral by 2050.
To ensure a liveable planet for future generations this mine must be prevented from being built.
attributes.additional_details:
To build this mine in the midst of a climate crisis not only contradicts the government's intentions to become carbon neutral, but also sends a message to the nation that short-term economic growth is to be prioritised over the long-term survival of our species and planet. 

Aside from this, such a project will cause immediate and irreparable damage to the local landscape and wildlife. 

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2020/oct/02/first-new-deep-coalmine-in-uk-for-30-years-gets-green-light

rejection.details:
Planning approval for this decisions is a matter for Cumbria County Council, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You can petition Cumbria County Council directly: https://councilportal.cumbria.gov.uk/mgepetitionlistdisplay.aspx

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to remove the power for local authorities to grant planning permission for new coal mines, if that is something you would like to happen.

attributes.action: Put David Attenborough on the £50 note (& change the colour to aquamarine).
attributes.background: The climate crisis is very evident and to honour Sir David Attenborough's life-long dedication to the environment, wildlife and marine life, he should be honoured further for this by being the face of the new £50 note.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to make this change because Sir David is the most influential climate & wildlife activist in the world. His work has been shown across the globe & he is dearly loved for his powerful messages by all. By having the UK put Sir David's face on the £50 note, you will not only be recognising his dedication but you will send the world an important message that individuals like Sir David must be honoured, supported and recognised. Especially in light of the climate crisis.

The economy and peoples mental health have to now take priority.

A review of the law & incentives to reduce littering in the UK

attributes.action: Implement a green recovery package
attributes.background:
Invest in:
-Clean transportation
-Renewable energy 
-Retrofit buildings to improve their energy efficiency
-Reduce waste and improve recycling
-Protect nature and wildlife and restore degraded habitats.
attributes.additional_details:
This is essential as the recovery package can either bring us closer or further away from our zero-net emissions target. It can secure our and our children's wellbeing. It can build a competitive Britain in renewable energy and transportation or see us fall behind other nations.
The Committee on Climate Change illustrated that spending on low-carbon activities would provide a bigger boost to the economy, in both the short and long term, than pursuing a traditional recovery.

Some may have to choose which animals should live or die. The government need to allow zoos to reopen with social distancing measures in place.

Places like Ikea and the retail shops opening should never come before poor innocent animals needing food. We can live without new furniture for a while but these animals need to be fed.

Zoos are also outside and the government have been telling us for ages it’s safer to be outside, so with the right measures in place please look at opening zoos before shops or as part of the next phase on 15th June. It cannot be left any longer with no help from the government.

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues in their current form

attributes.background: I would like to petition the UK government to ban the sale, lighting and releasing of Sky Lanterns across the UK, making it an offence for companies or individuals to release Sky lanterns either recreationally or as part of a display. I would like to see the sale of Sky Lanterns banned in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: When a Sky Lantern is released it is done so without control or direction & falls as dangerous flaming litter. The deliberate lighting & releasing of Sky Lanterns across the UK has resulted in wildlife & farm animals being badly burnt, choked & even killed. in 2020 Lanterns were responsible for burning Krefeld zoo to the ground. Lanterns have caused crop fires & damaged buildings. The Welsh Government has already banned Sky Lanterns from Welsh Skies, I am requesting UK Government to follow suit.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of SKY LANTERNS.
attributes.background: The government should ban the sale and use of sky lanterns. Sky lanterns cause damage to the environment and harm or kill wildlife they also create more litter in towns and the countryside.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should do more to protect out wildlife from sky lanterns as once they are set in the sky they have to come down somewhere.

lanterns. Sky lanterns also create a litter problem for towns and the countryside. They are also a fire hazard which puts an extra strain on emergency services if a fire occurs.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of sky lanterns in England
attributes.background: Sky lanterns have become popular over the past few years with people buying them to create light displays in the sky.  This involves starting a small fire in a paper lantern, which is then sent into the sky like a miniature hot air balloon.  They are however hazardous to humans, pets and wildlife:
attributes.additional_details:
They can start fires 

They can cause burns

They can cause injury/death to animals and birds that get tangled or ingest small parts

They become permanent litter where they land

They increase the burden on fire, medical and animal welfare services

They have been banned to use on council land in Wales since 2018.  
There should be a ban on both selling and using sky lanterns in England to prevent unnecessary fires, deaths and injuries to humans animals and birds.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: We would like the use of sky lanterns to be banned in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: We would like a complete ban on sky lanterns being released in the United Kingdom. They are a danger to wildlife, livestock, marine life and property. Part of the remains are often non-biodegradable leaving further danger to land and sea animals from ingestion or entanglement.
attributes.additional_details:

The simplest solution is a Government level ban.

Thank you.

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic cutlery in takeaways in UK
attributes.background:
The use of plastic imposes serious environmental damage worldwide. Doing our bit to reduce the damage can improve things. 
The markets have developed various biodegradable cutleries, where the use of plastic is becoming trivial. We do not need plastic cutlery anymore.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic is a very serious threat to the environment. It can cause damage to wildlife which then can also have a dangerous impact on us.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300152.

attributes.action: Only sell silent fireworks, REMOVE the bang and protect our animals!
attributes.background: Hear our cry for help, To help protect our animals and loved ones animal cruelty is not right we want some justice for animals and wildlife!
attributes.additional_details: When you watch a firework display you watch and look at the colours not the BANG noone can see the bang however our animals can hear it 10 x more than us, And its unfair why should they have to suffer for other peoples stupidity. Remove the bang from all fireworks, BANGS ARE NOT NEEDED ALL THEY DO IS CAUSE A NUSIENCE!!

rejection.details:
All fireworks make a noise, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Reduce the decibel limit on fireworks to 85 decibels, to reduce impact: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622900

attributes.action: Outdated 1960s tree felling laws must change to stop wildlife population decline
attributes.background:
Forest tree felling licences can't include 'enforceable conditions' to safeguard rare wildlife: https://theconversation.com/rare-woodland-wildlife-at-risk-because-of-50-year-old-tree-felling-rules-107535

Scotland has new law. Wales is bringing in new law. England must follow to halt wildlife loss
attributes.additional_details:
It's illegal to kill red squirrels. Yet English forests containing them aren't protected and can be cut down

The UK Forest Standard approach to sustainable forestry doesn't prevent this e.g. Welsh Government recognised 'a disjoint' between the Forestry Act and other environmental legislation, leading to gaps in wildlife protection:

https://www.thenational.wales/environment/19771766.planned-change-welsh-forestry-law-protect-red-squirrels/

Guidelines in England are no replacement for law change

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about existing rules relating to licenses granted under the Forestry Act, but we're not sure exactly what changes you'd like to be made to the legislation governing these licences.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban use of treatment for companion animals that contain Fipronil & Imidacloprid
attributes.background: There are about 10 million dogs and 11 millions cats in the UK, 80% of which are treated for fleas, often unnecessarily. These chemicals end up in our water courses - sometimes 30% above the safe limit. Fipronil and Imidacloprid have already been banned in farming. This must stop.
attributes.additional_details: If we do not ban these chemicals, it will continue to have a significant impact on our aquatic life and birds. After COP 26 and knowing how wildlife is being decimated, we must do all we can to stop this trend. Much more stringent tests must be put in place, to ensure over the counter and prescription treatments will not end up in the wider environment causing death and pollution.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587385

attributes.action: Change the sale of noisy fireworks to silent.
attributes.background: Instead of an all out ban affecting retail business. Support them to sell silent fireworks for 2022. Thousands of animals die each year; pet and wildlife. Impact is felt by children and adults with ASN/PTSD. UK should lead this change.
attributes.additional_details: The current laws on the sale of fireworks is out dated. By bringing in silent fireworks you are benefitting the environment and bringing communities together. With silent fireworks you wouldn't need heavy restrictions as currently used. More enncouragement for local businesses to invest. However, children and adults with ASN/PTSD can be included in attending events. Pet owners will not lose their pets is horrific circumstances. The benefits are evident.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599451

attributes.action: Total ban on loud fireworks, Only allow the sale of silent fireworks.
attributes.background:
Only allow the sale of silent fireworks. 
This festival is the most distressing time of year for anyone in Great Britain. 
Pet owners and families with elderly and autistic members are unnecessarily put in huge amounts of despair.
The distress can be completely eradicated  with silent fireworks
attributes.additional_details:
Many families are in despair during this festival,mainly because of the noise as are Many animals pets, livestock and wildlife. All are left in complete distress and confusion very little can be done to help them and each year needless animals die because of the shear noise. 
The explosions going off all around you is deafening and be felt through your body. If 10 homes in one street all set them off it can be felt inside your home.
Our elderly are unnecessarily left scared in their own homes.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban use and sale of non-silent fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599451

Make fireworks quieter: Review and reduce the decibel limit on fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590838

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all fireworks in the UK including organised displays.
attributes.background: Ban the use and sale of all fireworks and pyrotechnic displays in the United Kingdom as they disturb wildlife, produce waste and harm the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Around bonfire night, there is a noticeable increase in air pollution and decrease in air quality. This is from particulate matter and dioxins. Approximately 5-10% of all of the UKs dioxin emissions are on this night alone. As gunpowder is the main component, sulphur and metal oxides are emitted as well. 

If the uk is serious about becoming net zero then fireworks must go to meet these targets as well as to remove the litter they cause as well as disruptions and upset to wildlife.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599738

attributes.action: Change legislation to ensure fireworks are quiet/low noise to protect animals.
attributes.background: Every year there are a lot of scared animals because of the loud noises from fireworks, this can lead to a number of health conditions such as seizures, fits and even death. I would like the UK government to consider introducing a legislation that all fireworks sold should be quiet or low noise.
attributes.additional_details: We should be recognisng that  bonfire night, new years and other holidays is a time of celebration. However, due to the loudness of fireworks this leaves animals scared both within the home and within nature. This could be prevented with quiet or low noise fireworks. Still allowing people to enjoy these events while protecting our animals and wildlife from anxiety, illness or even death. Other countries have introduced this with great success. We should be following suit.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make fireworks quieter: Review and reduce the decibel limit on fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590838

Ban use and sale of non-silent fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599451

attributes.action: Clean up UK Oceans and Rivers so we're free to swim and protect ecodiversity
attributes.background: As water users we want to be able to get in the water as much as possible. But not only can we end up covered in raw sewage when it has been discharged, we're at risk of gastroenteritis, ear, nose and throat infections, skin infections, and even hepatitis and e-coli.
attributes.additional_details:
Water quality is also deadly for river and ocean wildlife, reducing biodiversity and causing huge damage to these delicate ecosystems. 

In 2020 alone, there were over 400,000 discharges of untreated sewage into UK rivers and 2,941 discharges into UK coastal bathing waters. 

We won't stand for this any longer.
#EndSewagePollution

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about cleanliness of oceans and waters, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Give the Environment Agency the funds and freedom to protect English rivers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586378

Make it illegal for water companies to dump sewage into rivers and seas: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599873

attributes.action: Keep Sherwood Forest NNR as a sanctuary for public health, not Robot Dogs & 5G
attributes.background: Uphold the National Nature Reserve designation for Sherwood Forest. Nottinghamshire County Council must hold a public consultation process to ask the public if they want £10m spent on 5G, Robot Dogs & Virtual Reality in a place of International standing for nature & the people's Legend Robin Hood.
attributes.additional_details:
Scrutinise Nottinghamshire County Council's proposals regarding this technological venture and their processes.

Are Nottinghamshire County Council upholding the aim of protecting Sherwood Forest for the people of Nottinghamshire and its wildlife, or are they  turning into a theme park for politicians and academics, in exchange for monetary gain either from Government or commercial enterprise?

rejection.details:
Planning decisions about Sherwood Forest are a matter for Nottinghamshire County Council, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about planning decisions in your area you could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Ban single use plastics in supermarkets
attributes.background: Ban single use plastics and make all packaging recyclable
attributes.additional_details: Plastic takes a very long time to degrade and when it degrades it turns micro plastics. It threatens wildlife by spreading toxins. Plastic waste ends up in the oceans threatening marine life. It also contributes to global warming. Plastic not only affects wildlife but also human health. Almost all plastics are made from chemicals that come from the production of planet-warming fuels (gas, oil and even coal).

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586547

attributes.action: Take action on the climate emergency
attributes.background: Emergency action is needed to ensure the survival of our species and planet. Implement a ban on plastic packaging for fruit/veg, & single use plastic bags. Donate in date food waste to food banks/homeless shelters. Protect green land from development. Ban selling fossil fuels and petrol vehicles.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 70% of litter in the ocean is made of plastic. Plastic pollution is harmful to wildlife and humans.

Food waste is responsible for more than 25 million tonnes of greenhouse gas emissions in the UK per year. Greenhouse gas emissions from road transport has increased by 6% from 1990-2017. In 2017, 21% of all greenhouse gas emissions came from road transport

Record high temperatures and severe flooding have been seen in increasing amounts across the UK and the planet.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban all single-use plastic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586547

Ban the use of plastic packaging for all non-food items: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570065

Ban the use of virgin plastics in all packaging sold in the UK before 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586539

attributes.action: Keep (It) Off The Grass! Stop tarmacking our bridleways and byways!
attributes.background: Stop tarmacking enjoyable access of grassy tracks where one can, enjoy a canter or a more natural walk or run in the countryside. Re-evaluate critically on the use of the paths and its nearby access options with proper users' and locals' consultations before deciding to re-surface.
attributes.additional_details: Horse riders thoroughly enjoy using grassy tracks that benefits their horses and plays an important part of their sport and exercise regime. Bridleways especially should be protected for horses. Cyclists have a lot of their own paths and some of them - alongside other users - also enjoy the tracks in their more natural state. It provides better connection to the countryside and nature therefore better wellbeing and health for people. Grassy tracks also provide wildlife and climate more support.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about surfacing bridleways and byways are a matter for the relevant landowner or local authority, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Include vehicle battery and charger manufacture in vehicle emissions measurement
attributes.background: Government must include battery and charger manufacture in emissions measurement for cars not 'tailpipe only' as it is an unfair measurement. We must account for harmful practices to the planet such as Lithium extraction as it can kill wildlife on a large scale due to for example water shortages.
attributes.additional_details:
Clean fuels use normal petrol or diesel pumps, no need for environmentally damaging charger installs everywhere.
Battery manufacture creates high co2 emissions, adds cost & Lithium is not renewable!
To be practical for widespread EV car and van use we will need a huge amount of chargers to be made which will increase emissions not reduce it!
Cobalt mining is still using Child Labour.
Biomethane can be CO2 negative full lifecycle.
Synthetic fuels such as electrofuels can be made with clean energy

rejection.details: We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure for what purposes you'd like other emissions to be measured, for example to calculate vehicle tax, or to change the way that manufacturers are required to report CO2 emissions to the Government (such as here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/report-co2-emissions-for-new-cars-and-vans)

attributes.action: Stop allowing freshwater fish to be taken from our rivers
attributes.background: Make it an offence to take freshwater fish from our rivers.
attributes.additional_details: Currently some freshwater fish are allowed to be taken to eat. our rivers cannot support this. In a very short time they will be devoid of fish forever. We must protect the wildlife in our rivers

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Review freshwater rod fishing bylaws reduce daily limit of course fish taken.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570198

Ban all fishing, for sport and food.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572791

attributes.action: Ban the insecticide fipronil from all UK pet flea & tick products
attributes.background: The Government needs to ban the insecticide fipronil from all pet flea and tick products in the UK to protect the fish in our rivers. The UK's wildlife is already vulnerable and this toxic chemical is damaging our aquatic life, despite only being found in flea products.
attributes.additional_details: Fipronil is an insecticide that was banned by the EU for agricultural purposes in 2017. It is still a common ingredient in pet flea treatments, but is highly toxic to fish. Fipronil enters our waterways through household drains from washing our pets, their bedding and our hands. It was found in 99% of rivers studied and breaks down into a product 3 to 6 times more toxic. One dog can kill an entire pond of fish when treated with fipronil. It needs to be removed from our environment and homes.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign this petition which we currently have open:

Ban the sale and use of Fipronil and Imidacloprid in flea treatments for pets
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560905
